audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Clear functional optimization - AI augmenting employee productivity across general workplace tasks. Pattern is replicable across organizations using similar tools.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Specific quantified metric (105 minutes/week) but source appears to be Google marketing material. No independent verification or methodology disclosed.
audited_claims.notes: Strong time savings claim but needs independent verification given vendor source

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Describes quality improvement in existing work processes. Replicable pattern for AI-assisted work enhancement.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Percentage metric provided (75%) but lacks definition of 'quality improvement' and methodology. Vendor-sourced statistic.
audited_claims.notes: Quality improvement claim is vague without specific quality metrics or measurement criteria

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: This is an adoption statistic, not a functional optimization claim. No specific process improvement described.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: While specific (100,000+ organizations), this is a market penetration claim rather than an efficiency/capability improvement.
audited_claims.notes: Market adoption statistic, not a capability case claim

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Clear optimization of customer feedback analysis process. Dramatic time reduction (2-4 hours to 5-6 minutes) in bounded, repeatable task. Pattern applicable to other customer service operations.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Named organization (Etsy), specific quantified improvement, detailed process description. Credible efficiency gain.

apqc_functions.name: Plan and manage customer service contacts

audited_claims.notes: Strong capability case with named customer and dramatic, measurable process improvement

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Clear productivity optimization for development team. Replicable pattern for software development functions.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Named organization (FinQuery) and specific metric (5% productivity boost), but relatively modest gain and no methodology provided.

apqc_functions.name: Develop and manage IT resilience and risk

audited_claims.notes: Modest but credible productivity claim from named organization

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Specific optimization of development tasks (unit testing, component writing). Clear efficiency gain in bounded processes. Highly replicable across software development teams.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Named organization (FinQuery), specific tasks identified, dramatic time improvement (hours to minutes). Detailed and credible.

apqc_functions.name: Develop and manage IT resilience and risk

audited_claims.notes: Strong capability case with specific development tasks and significant time savings

audited_claims.strategic_fit_assessment: Clear optimization of two distinct functions: research and donor outreach. Significant time savings in repeatable processes. Pattern applicable to other nonprofits and research organizations.
audited_claims.evidence_quality_assessment: Named organization (Understood.org), specific quantified savings for two different processes (10 hours/project, 2 hours/day). Credible and detailed.

apqc_functions.name: Develop and manage enterprise-wide knowledge management (KM) capability

audited_claims.notes: Strong dual-function optimization case with significant time savings in research and fundraising activities

tier_verification: Correctly classified as tier 1. All claims describe functional optimization and efficiency gains within existing business processes, not business model transformation.
